data.title: Advent Sunday
data.solution:
from datetime import date, timedelta
import sys

y = int(input())
day = input()

# just to make sure I didn't bodge the testcases ...
months = ["January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December"]
weekdays = ["Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday", "Saturday", "Sunday"]
#print(date.fromisoformat(f"{y}0101").weekday(), file=sys.stderr)
assert day == weekdays[date.fromisoformat(f"{y}0101").weekday()]

# that's the earliest possible day:
advent = date.fromisoformat(f"{y}1127")
for i in range(7):
    if advent.weekday() == 6:
        print(advent.day, months[advent.month-1])
    advent += timedelta(days=1)
data.statement:
It's New Year's Day (1st of January) and you can't wait for the next Christmas. 

Find the day [[d]] and the month [[m]] of this year's <<Advent Sunday>>, which is the fourth Sunday before Christmas day (25th of December). 

You are given the year [[y]] and the weekday [[day]] of New Year's day.

Hints: Assume leap years according to the Gregorian calendar. The Advent Sunday will be either one of the last days in {{November}} or one of the first days in {{December}}).

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

It's New Year's Day (1st of January) and you can't wait for the next Christmas.

Find the day d and the month m of this year's Advent Sunday, which is the fourth Sunday before Christmas day (25th of December).

You are given the year y and the weekday day of New Year's day.

Hints: Assume leap years according to the Gregorian calendar. The Advent Sunday will be either one of the last days in November or one of the first days in December).
Input
Line 1: An integer y for the year that starts today!
Line 2: A string day with today's weekday (one of the following: Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday or Sunday)
Output
A single line containing the date of Advent Sunday in the form d m, where the day of the month d is separated from the month m by a single space.
Constraints
1582 < y < 2100
Example
Input
2022
Saturday
Output
27 November
